auth.authPersist: If this persists, you can try to:

signIn.subtitle: Sign in to Quester to continue to your research workspace

landing.heroSubtitle: Organize, track, and collaborate on research projects with your team

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.workspaceOverview: Here's what's happening in your workspace.

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Manage your account and preferences
settings.orcidDescription: Your ORCID iD provides a persistent digital identifier that distinguishes you from other researchers.
settings.orcidValidation: Please enter a valid ORCID URL (e.g., https://orcid.org/0000-0000-0000-0000)
settings.noPermission: You don't have permission to manage organization settings
settings.orgNotAvailable: Organization settings are not available on your current plan. Please upgrade to access organization settings.
settings.subscribeDescription: Choose a subscription plan to continue using Quester
settings.languageDescription: Choose your preferred language for the application interface. Changes take effect immediately.

team.title: Team Management
team.subtitle: Manage your team members, invitations, and roles
team.inviteDescription: Invite a new member to your organization
team.selectResourceTooltip: Select a resource to manage its team members, roles, and permissions.
team.selectResourceToManage: Select a resource to manage its team
team.selectResourceDescription: Choose an organization, department, or project from the sidebar to manage its team members and permissions.
team.manageTeamFor: Manage team members and their roles for this {resourceType}
team.sendInvitationsDescription: Send invitations to add new team members to this organization
team.addExistingUsersDescription: Add users who are already members of the parent organization
team.inviteModalDescription: For {resourceType}s, you can add existing organization members or use the main organization invitation feature.
team.tourPrompt: Would you like a quick tour to learn how to manage your teams effectively?
team.restartTourHint: You can restart the tour anytime using the "Tour" button in the header.
team.tourCompleted: Tour completed! You're ready to manage your teams.
team.canRestartTour: You can always restart the tour from the help menu

teamManagement.title: Team Management
teamManagement.failedToJoin: Failed to join. Please try again.

projects.title: Projects
projects.createFirst: Create your first project to get started
projects.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this project?

projectSettings.title: Settings
projectSettings.tooltip: Configure your project settings, manage custom designs, and handle data export or deletion options for your research project.
projectSettings.selectProjectFirst: No project selected. Please select a project first.
projectSettings.exportDescription: Download all your project data, including literature, notes, outcomes, and analyses, as a zip file.
projectSettings.deleteDescription: Permanently remove this project and all its associated data. This action cannot be undone.
projectSettings.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this project? This action cannot be undone.

literature.title: Literature
literature.addFirstDocument: Add your first document to get started
literature.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this document?
literature.manageAndOrganize: Manage and organize your project literature
literature.tooltip: Manage and organize your project literature. Add sources, track reading status, and build your research library all in one place.

insights.title: Insights
insights.tooltip: Analyze keyword patterns and relationships across your research to discover emerging themes and connections in your literature.
insights.description: Gain insights into keyword patterns and relationships across your research

history.title: Insights History
history.description: View all previously generated insights for this project
history.emptyDescription: This project doesn't have any historical insights yet. Generate some insights to see them here!

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.description: Get a high-level view of your project's status and key components.

literatureView.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.
literatureView.citedFromPage: This item was cited from page {page}.
literatureView.uploadFileTypes: Upload a PDF, DOCX, DOC, or TXT. We will extract text and metadata.
literatureView.reportIssueDescription: Help us improve by reporting issues with "{name}"
literatureView.describeIssuePlaceholder: Describe the issue you noticed (e.g., incorrect metadata, missing text, wrong extraction)...
literatureView.feedbackThanks: Your feedback will help us improve. Thank you!

models.title: Models
models.createFirst: Create your first model to get started
models.manageResearchModels: Create and manage your research models
models.tooltip: Create and manage research models to visualize your concepts and relationships.
models.giveModelName: Give your model a name. You can change it later.
models.name: Name
models.deleteModelConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.

notes.title: Notes
notes.createFirst: Create your first note to get started
notes.tooltip: Create, manage, and organize your research and literature notes. Use split view and focus mode for enhanced productivity. (Toggle focus mode: Cmd/Ctrl+B)
notes.description: Create, manage, and organize your research and literature notes
notes.selectOrCreateNote: Select a note from the sidebar or create a new one

editor.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this note? This action cannot be undone.

outcomes.title: Outcomes
outcomes.createFirst: Create your first outcome to get started
outcomes.tooltip: Create and manage research outcomes to track your findings and questions.
outcomes.createAndManage: Create and manage your project outcomes
outcomes.giveOutcomeName: Give your outcome a name and select a template.
outcomes.name: Name
outcomes.deleteOutcomeConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.
outcomes.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this outcome? This action cannot be undone.

researchQuestion.name: Research Question
researchQuestion.title: Research Question
researchQuestion.primaryQuestionPrompt: State your main research question here - ensure it is specific, measurable, and answerable
researchQuestion.identifyVariables: Identify key variables and their relationships
researchQuestion.subQuestion1: What specific aspects or dimensions need to be investigated?
researchQuestion.subQuestion2: What contextual factors need to be considered?

chat.title: Chat
chat.startConversation: Start a conversation with your AI research assistant
chat.startNewConversation: Start a new conversation to begin
chat.deleteChatSessionConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this chat session? This action cannot be undone.
chat.askAboutResearch: Ask questions about your research, get insights, or explore your data...
chat.summarizeDescription: Get an overview of your latest research progress
chat.keyThemes: What are the key themes in my literature?
chat.keyThemesDescription: Identify patterns and trends across your sources
chat.findGapsDescription: Discover unexplored areas in your field
chat.nextSteps: What are my next research steps?
chat.nextStepsDescription: Get recommendations for continuing your work

onboarding.workspaceExists: You already have a workspace created

pricing.title: Choose Your Plan
pricing.subtitle: Select the plan that best fits your needs
pricing.customizedSolutions: Customized solutions for teams and institutions
pricing.teamWillReach: Someone from our team will reach out to you soon to schedule a demo.
pricing.getFullDemo: Get a full demo of how Quester works

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.projectAnalyticsTooltip: Visualize and analyze your project's literature collection and notes content. Track trends in publications, identify common themes, and gain insights into your research landscape.
analytics.activityOverview: Activity overview across your projects and users.
analytics.analyticsTooltip: View comprehensive analytics about your organization's activity, including user engagement patterns, project content creation, and team productivity metrics across all your projects.
analytics.noPermission: You don't have permission to view organization analytics. This page requires organization admin, owner, or department admin privileges.
analytics.totalUsersTooltip: Total number of all users in your organization.
analytics.activeUsers7DaysTooltip: Number of users who logged in at least once during the past 7 days.
analytics.activeUsers30DaysTooltip: Number of users who logged in at least once during the past 30 days.
analytics.activityRateTooltip: Percentage of total possible user-days with login activity in the last 7 days. Calculated as: (total active days / (total users × 7 days)) × 100%.
analytics.selectProjectsHint: Click on project rows to view their activity charts below. You can select multiple projects to compare their activity.
analytics.noProjectsWithActivity: No projects with activity data found for this organization.
analytics.activityDataCollection: Activity data is collected when team members create or modify resources in a project.
analytics.searchUsersPlaceholder: Search users by name or email...
analytics.toggleYearsTimePeriods: Toggle between individual years and time periods

errors.generic: Something went wrong. Please try again.
errors.network: Network error. Please check your connection.
errors.unauthorized: You are not authorized to perform this action.
errors.notFound: The requested resource was not found.
errors.validation: Please check your input and try again.
errors.serverError: Server error. Please try again later.
errors.timeout: Request timed out. Please try again.
errors.sessionExpired: Your session has expired. Please sign in again.
errors.failedToLoadAchievements: Failed to load achievements. Please try again later.
errors.lastOwnerCannotChange: The last Organization Owner's role cannot be changed
errors.failedToJoin: Failed to join. Please try again.

validation.email: Please enter a valid email address

welcome.title: Welcome to Your Dashboard
welcome.description: This is your main hub for navigating your Quester workspace. See your organization's structure and manage settings.

organizationStructure.title: Organization Structure
organizationStructure.description: View and manage your departments and projects here. Let's explore this section.

viewModeToggle.title: Switch Views
viewModeToggle.description: Toggle between a hierarchical 'Tree View' and a flat 'List View' to see your projects and departments.

newDepartment.title: Create Departments
newDepartment.description: Organize your projects by creating departments (if your role and subscription allow).

newProject.title: Create Projects
newProject.description: Start new research projects directly from here (permissions and subscription permitting).

search.title: Search Projects
search.description: Quickly find projects by searching for their name.

filter.title: Filter Your View
filter.description: Toggle this to show only the projects for which you are a member.

header.title: Manage Your Settings
header.description: This area allows you to manage your personal profile information and, if applicable, settings for your organization.

tabs.title: Switch Between Settings Areas
tabs.description: Use these tabs to navigate between your personal Profile settings and the Organization settings (if available on your plan).

profile.title: Your Profile Information
profile.description: Update your first and last name here. Your email address cannot be changed.

saveButton.title: Save Profile Changes
saveButton.description: Click here to save any updates made to your name.

organizationTab.title: Organization Settings Tab
organizationTab.description: Access settings for your current organization here. This tab may be disabled depending on your subscription plan.

organizationContent.title: Organization-Specific Settings
organizationContent.description: Manage invitations and content creation permissions for your organization. Note that some settings may be owner-only.

disableInvitations.title: Control Invitations
disableInvitations.description: (Owner Only) Enable or disable the ability for anyone to invite new members to this organization.

allowMemberInvites.title: Delegate Invitations
allowMemberInvites.description: (Owner Only) If invitations are enabled, choose whether regular members and admins (not just owners) can invite others.

membersCreateProjects.title: Project Creation Permission
membersCreateProjects.description: (Admin/Owner) Decide if regular members should be allowed to create new projects within this organization.

keepUpdated.title: Keep Your Information Up-to-Date
keepUpdated.description: Regularly review your profile and organization settings to ensure they reflect your current needs and preferences.

chooseTeam.title: Choose Your Team
chooseTeam.description: Select an organization, department, or project from the sidebar to start managing its team members.

teamMembers.title: Your Team Members
teamMembers.description: Here you can see all team members, their roles, and manage their access permissions.

invitations.title: Invite New Members
invitations.description: Send email invitations to add new people to your organization.

addUsers.title: Add Existing Users
addUsers.description: Add people who are already in your organization to this specific project or department.

welcome.title: Welcome to Organization Analytics
welcome.description: This page provides a high-level overview of activity and engagement across your organization's projects and users. Use it to monitor progress, identify trends, and understand resource usage.

summaryMetrics.title: Key Performance Indicators
summaryMetrics.description: These cards show vital signs for your organization: total users, recent user activity (last 7 and 30 days), and the overall activity rate. Quickly gauge the health and engagement level of your workspace.

projectActivity.title: Project Content Activity
projectActivity.description: This section tracks the creation and modification of research content (Literature, Notes, Models, Outcomes) within each project.

dateRange.title: Filter by Time
dateRange.description: Adjust the date range (7, 14, 30 days, or All Time) to focus the activity data in the table and charts on specific periods. Useful for tracking recent progress or long-term trends.

projectSearch.title: Find Projects Quickly
projectSearch.description: Use this search bar to filter the table below and find specific projects by name.

projectTable.title: Project Activity Details
projectTable.description: This table lists projects with recent activity. Click headers to sort. The columns quantify added content, helping identify active research areas. Use the checkboxes to select projects for detailed charting below.

projectActions.title: Project Actions
projectActions.description: Quickly view the users associated with a project or navigate directly to the project workspace.

projectCharts.title: Visualize Project Trends
projectCharts.description: When you select projects in the table above, detailed activity charts appear here. Compare trends across projects or dive deep into a single project's content creation patterns over the selected date range.

userActivity.title: User Login Activity
userActivity.description: Monitor user engagement by tracking login frequency. This helps identify active contributors and users who might need support.

userSearch.title: Find Users Quickly
userSearch.description: Search for specific users by name or email to check their recent login activity.

userTable.title: User Login Details
userTable.description: See when each user last logged in and how many distinct days they were active over different periods (7, 14, 30 days, All Time). Click headers to sort and easily identify engagement patterns.

overview.title: Monitor Your Organization's Pulse
overview.description: Regularly use this Analytics page to understand research activity, track user engagement, and make informed decisions about resource allocation and support.

header.title: Manage Your Literature
header.description: This page is your central hub for organizing all the articles, books, and other sources for your project. Keep everything in one place!

addButton.title: Add New Sources Easily
addButton.description: Click here to add new literature items. You can paste formatted references or enter details manually.

search.title: Find Literature Quickly
search.description: Use this search bar to instantly filter your literature list by title, author, year, or keyword.

table.title: Your Literature Library
table.description: All your added literature appears here. Click column headers to sort, or click a row to view/edit details.

addTwoWays.title: Adding Literature: Two Ways
addTwoWays.description: Let's look at how to add literature. Quester can automatically parse pasted references or you can enter details by hand.

pasteReference.title: Add Via Reference (Pasting)
pasteReference.description: Paste one or more references here (like APA, MLA). Quester will try to extract the details automatically. Saves a lot of typing!

manualEntry.title: Switch to Manual Entry
manualEntry.description: Alternatively, click here to add details field-by-field.

manualFields.title: Add Manually
manualFields.description: Fill in the necessary fields like Title, Authors, Year, etc. This gives you full control over the entry.

finishAdding.title: Finish Adding
finishAdding.description: Once you've added your reference(s), confirm or save them. That's how you build your literature library!

organize.title: Ready to Organize?
organize.description: Use this page to efficiently manage your literature review. Keep sources organized, track reading status, and easily find what you need.

header.title: Manage Your Research Models
header.description: This is where you create, view, and organize visual models of your research concepts and their relationships. Models help you map out theories and complex ideas.

createButton.title: Create a New Model
createButton.description: Click here to start a new model. Give it a name, and you'll be taken to the editor to begin mapping your ideas.

search.title: Find Your Models
search.description: Use the search bar to quickly find specific models by name as your collection grows.

grid.title: Your Model Collection
grid.description: All your created models are displayed here. Click on a card to open the editor. You can also rename or delete models using the icons that appear on hover.

visualize.title: Visualize Your Research
visualize.description: Use models to visually structure your thoughts, theories, and connections within your research. It's a powerful way to gain clarity and communicate complex ideas.

loading.title: Loading Your Model
loading.description: Quester is now checking your access permissions and loading the selected model data. This usually only takes a moment.

welcome.title: Welcome to Model Builder!
welcome.description: Let's take an interactive tour! I'll demonstrate how to build models by automatically adding nodes and connecting them. Watch as we explore each feature!

toolbar.title: Model Building Toolbar
toolbar.description: This toolbar lets you add different types of nodes to build your model. Watch as I create a node for you!

firstNode.title: Your First Node!
firstNode.description: Here's the node I created for you! You can drag it around, resize it using the handles, and double-click to edit its content. Click on it to see the editing options!

nodeMenu.title: Node Editing Menu
nodeMenu.description: Perfect! When you select a node, this menu appears. Here you can customize the node's appearance - change colors, borders, text styling, and add effects. Try clicking the different tabs!

addingNodes.title: Adding More Nodes
addingNodes.description: Let me add another node so we can connect them with arrows!

connecting.title: Connecting Nodes with Arrows
connecting.description: Perfect! Now I'll demonstrate how to connect nodes. Watch as I automatically create a connection between these two nodes. In practice, you'd drag from one node's handle to another.

arrows.title: Arrows Show Relationships
arrows.description: Excellent! This arrow shows the relationship between your concepts. Click on any arrow to customize its appearance - change colors, add arrowheads, or make it animated!

customizeArrows.title: Customize Your Arrows
customizeArrows.description: This panel appeared when I selected the arrow! Here you can change the arrow's style, color, thickness, add arrowheads, and even make it animated to show dynamic relationships.

navigation.title: Navigation Controls
navigation.description: Use these controls to zoom in/out, fit your entire model to the view, and lock/unlock canvas panning. Very handy for large, complex models!

minimap.title: Minimap for Large Models
minimap.description: This minimap shows an overview of your entire model. Click and drag within it to quickly navigate large canvases. It's especially useful for complex research models!

building.title: Building Your Research Model
building.description: Now you know the basics! Add rectangle nodes for concepts, circle nodes for variables, connect them with arrows to show relationships. Use the grid and snap settings to keep things organized. You're ready to build your research model!

header.title: Manage Your Outcomes
header.description: This page is where you create, view, and manage all the outcomes, findings, or links related to your research project.

createButton.title: Initiate Outcome Creation
createButton.description: Clicking this button opens a dialog where you can start creating a new outcome (a research finding, question, or link).

search.title: Find Outcomes Quickly
search.description: Use this search bar to filter your outcomes list by name.

grid.title: Your Outcome Collection
grid.description: All your outcomes are displayed here as cards. Click a card to view/edit (for outcomes) or open (for links). Hover over a card to see edit/delete options.

journalSuggestions.title: Get Journal Suggestions
journalSuggestions.description: Based on the literature you've added, Quester suggests relevant journals for potential publication. Click 'Explain' for details on the scoring.

conferenceSuggestions.title: Find Relevant Conferences
conferenceSuggestions.description: Similarly, Quester suggests conferences where your research might be a good fit for presentation.

createOutcome.title: Let's Create an Outcome
createOutcome.description: We'll walk through the creation process. You can create a detailed research outcome or a simple link.

selectType.title: 1. Select Outcome Type
selectType.description: First, categorize your outcome. Choose 'Research Outcome' for findings, questions, or analyses that need detailed documentation (using a template), or 'Link' for simply saving relevant external URLs.

nameOutcome.title: 2. Name Your Outcome
nameOutcome.description: Provide a clear, concise name that summarizes this outcome or link. This helps you identify it later.

addDetails.title: 3. Add Details (Type Specific)
addDetails.description: If creating a 'Link', paste the URL here. If creating a 'Research Outcome', choose a template (like 'Key Finding' or 'Research Question') to structure the information you'll add next.

createSubmit.title: 4. Create the Outcome
createSubmit.description: Clicking here saves the outcome. 'Link' types are saved immediately. 'Research Outcome' types will open a dedicated editor based on the template you selected, ready for you to document the details.

manageExisting.title: Manage Existing Outcomes
manageExisting.description: Hover over any card to reveal buttons for renaming (pencil icon) or deleting (trash icon) the outcome.

ready.title: Ready to Document Your Findings?
ready.description: Use the Outcomes page to keep track of key results, questions, and useful links throughout your research process. Stay organized!

visualize.title: Visualize Your Research Connections
visualize.description: This view maps out the relationships between your literature, notes, keywords, and concepts. It helps you discover hidden patterns, identify research gaps, and understand the structure of your project.

dimensions.title: Switch Between Dimensions
dimensions.description: Toggle between a 2D network graph and an immersive 3D view to explore your connections from different perspectives.

legend.title: Understand the Symbols
legend.description: Click here to open the legend, which explains what each icon (node) in the graph represents (e.g., literature, note, keyword).

controls.title: Show/Hide Interaction Hints
controls.description: Toggle this to display or hide helpful tips on how to navigate and interact with the graph (zooming, panning, selecting).

interact.title: Interact with the Graph
interact.description: Explore the graph area below! Use your mouse to zoom, pan, and select nodes. In 2D, you can drag nodes; in 3D, rotate the view. Check the controls hints if needed.

discover.title: Discover Insights
discover.description: Use this visualization to see how ideas connect, identify clusters of related work, spot potential research gaps, and gain a deeper understanding of your research landscape.

welcome.title: Welcome to Notes
welcome.description: Capture, organize, and manage your research and literature notes. Use the controls here to manage your view and create new notes.

filterType.title: Filter by Note Type
filterType.description: Switch between viewing notes specifically linked to literature items and general research notes for your project.

notesList.title: Your Notes List
notesList.description: All your notes for the selected type appear here. Use the search bar at the top to filter them instantly.

createNote.title: Create a New Note
createNote.description: Click here to start a new note. It will be automatically saved as you type.

editor.title: Rich Text Editor
editor.description: Write and format your notes here. Changes are saved automatically. You can attach notes to literature entries from within the editor.

splitView.title: Toggle Split View
splitView.description: Switch between viewing one note or two notes side-by-side for comparison or referencing.

focusMode.title: Toggle Focus Mode
focusMode.description: Hide the sidebar to focus solely on the editor. Use the button or Cmd/Ctrl+B to toggle.

ready.title: Ready to Take Notes?
ready.description: Use these features to keep your thoughts organized and connected to your research sources.

welcome.title: Welcome to Your Project Overview
welcome.description: This is your central hub for managing your research project. Let's explore the key sections that help you stay organized and focused.

projectCore.title: Define Your Project's Core
projectCore.description: Start here by clearly defining your project's purpose and setting its current status. A clear purpose keeps your research focused, while the status helps track progress and funding. Use the AI rewrite tool to refine your statement!

keywords.title: Tag Your Research Themes
keywords.description: Add relevant keywords to categorize your project. This makes it easier to find later and helps Quester connect related ideas across your research. Aim for 3-7 core terms.

methodology.title: Outline Your Methodology
methodology.description: Document your research, sampling, measurement, and analytic designs. Clearly defining your methodology ensures consistency and rigor throughout your project.

deliverables.title: Track Your Deliverables
deliverables.description: Manage your research outputs like papers, reports, or presentations. Keep track of their status and deadlines to stay on top of your publication goals.

health.title: Check Your Project's Health
health.description: This card highlights missing setup steps or areas needing attention, ensuring your project is well-structured. Regularly reviewing insights helps maintain momentum.

nextSteps.title: Focus Your Next Steps
nextSteps.description: See prioritized literature items needing review and recent updates here. This helps you tackle the most important tasks first and stay informed about progress.

ready.title: Ready to Get Started?
ready.description: Use this Overview page regularly to keep your research organized, focused, and on track from conception to publication. Explore each section to make the most of Quester!

header.title: Track Your Research Journey
header.description: This page visualizes your project's activity, milestones, and achievements, helping you understand your progress over time.

researchLevel.title: Your Research Level
researchLevel.description: Gain Experience Points (XP) by completing research activities and achievements. Level up to unlock new titles reflecting your mastery!

viewLevels.title: Explore All Levels
viewLevels.description: Click here to see all the available research levels, their XP requirements, and descriptions.

tabs.title: Navigate Progress Views
tabs.description: Switch between the 'Project Timeline' view, showing chronological events, and the 'Achievements' view, tracking specific milestones.

timeline.title: Project Timeline
timeline.description: See key project events like creation, status changes, literature additions, and note creation laid out chronologically. Click items for more details.

switchToAchievements.title: Switch to Achievements
switchToAchievements.description: Now let's look at the specific achievements you can unlock.

achievements.title: Achievements
achievements.description: Unlock achievements by performing specific actions like adding literature, writing notes, or using features consistently. Completed achievements award XP towards your Research Level.

monitor.title: Monitor Your Momentum
monitor.description: Check this page regularly to visualize your research activity, celebrate milestones, and stay motivated on your journey!

header.title: Literature Item Details
header.description: This page provides a detailed view of a single literature item. Here you can manage its details, track status, add keywords, view insights, and generate citations.

goBack.title: Go Back
goBack.description: Return to the main literature list for this project.

viewDocument.title: View Document
viewDocument.description: Open the original document file in your browser for reading and review.

downloadDocument.title: Download Document
downloadDocument.description: Download the original document file to your computer.

deleteItem.title: Delete Item
deleteItem.description: Permanently remove this literature item and all associated notes from your project.

trackStatus.title: Track Reading Status
trackStatus.description: Monitor and update the progress of reading and processing this literature item. Click 'Change Status' to update.

coreInfo.title: Core Information
coreInfo.description: View and edit the fundamental details of this literature item, such as title, authors, publication year, and type. Click 'Edit' to make changes.

methodology.title: Methodology Details
methodology.description: Categorize the research, sampling, measurement, and analytic designs used in this literature according to your project's framework. Click 'Edit' to modify.

health.title: Literature Health & Setup
health.description: Check the completeness of this literature entry. Expand this section to see recommended fields to fill out for better organization and citation quality.

addKeywords.title: Add Keywords
addKeywords.description: Tag this literature with relevant keywords. This helps in organizing your sources and identifying thematic connections across your research.

generateCitations.title: Generate Citations
generateCitations.description: Quickly generate citations in various common styles (APA, MLA, etc.) based on the entered details. Use the dropdown to select a style and the button to copy.

manageSource.title: Manage Your Source
manageSource.description: Use this detailed view to thoroughly document, analyze, and integrate this piece of literature into your research project.

configure.title: Configure Your Project
configure.description: Manage your project's basic settings, custom designs, and data options here.

projectName.title: Update Project Name
projectName.description: Change the project name here and click 'Save Changes' when done.

customDesigns.title: Manage Custom Designs
customDesigns.description: Add, edit, or remove custom options for your research, sampling, measurement, and analytic designs to tailor Quester to your specific methodology.

dangerZone.title: Danger Zone
dangerZone.description: Be careful! This section contains actions like exporting or permanently deleting your project.

exportData.title: Export Project Data
exportData.description: Download a zip file containing all your project data (literature, notes, designs, etc.) for backup or use elsewhere.

deleteProject.title: Delete Project
deleteProject.description: Permanently delete this project and all its data. This action cannot be undone, so proceed with caution!

welcome.title: Welcome to Keyword Analysis
welcome.description: This tool helps you understand keyword frequency and relationships within your project's literature. Discover patterns, identify research gaps, and refine your focus.

startFirst.title: Start Your First Analysis
startFirst.description: You haven't run any analyses yet. Click 'Create Your First Analysis' to begin exploring keyword connections.

inputKeywords.title: Input Your Keywords
inputKeywords.description: Enter 2-10 keywords relevant to your research questions. Quester will then search your literature for occurrences and co-occurrences.

exploring.title: Exploring Your Keyword Analysis
exploring.description: This analysis reveals patterns in your selected keywords across your project literature. Let's break down the results.

resultsOverview.title: Analysis Results Overview
resultsOverview.description: Here you'll find a summary, visualizations, and detailed tables showing how your keywords appear and overlap in your sources.

aiSummary.title: AI-Generated Summary
aiSummary.description: Read an AI-generated interpretation of the keyword patterns, potential research gaps, and areas of high concentration. A great starting point for insights!

frequencyChart.title: Frequency Distribution Chart
frequencyChart.description: Visualize how often each keyword appears individually. Identify the most dominant terms in your literature set.

vennDiagram.title: Keyword Overlap (Venn Diagram)
vennDiagram.description: Select 2 or 3 keywords to see their co-occurrence visually. Click on sections to filter literature containing specific keyword combinations (opens Google Scholar).

frequencyTable.title: Frequency Distribution Table
frequencyTable.description: See the exact counts and percentages for each keyword. Click counts to view corresponding results on Google Scholar. Download the data as CSV.

crossTable.title: Cross Distribution Table
crossTable.description: Examine the co-occurrence frequency for every pair of keywords. Identify which terms frequently appear together. Download as CSV.

tripleTable.title: Three-Way Distribution Table
tripleTable.description: Explore the co-occurrence for combinations of three keywords. Available when 3+ keywords are analyzed. Download as CSV.

previousAnalyses.title: Previous Analyses
previousAnalyses.description: Access your past analyses here. Click on one to view its results again or delete analyses you no longer need.

newAnalysis.title: Run a New Analysis
newAnalysis.description: Explore different keyword combinations or update your analysis as your literature grows by running a new analysis anytime.

progress.title: Progress
progress.pinnacleOfMastery: You've reached the pinnacle of research mastery

eventDescriptions.addedLiteratureItem: 1 literature item added to the project

keywordAnalysis.keywordOverlapDescription: Values show Google Scholar search result counts. Numbers represent total documents containing the keywords (individual) or keyword combinations (overlaps), not exclusive regions.

keywordAnalysis.tooltipScholarNote: Numbers may differ from Google Scholar UI as we display exact values from the database, while Scholar's UI shows approximations.

organizationSettings.title: Organization Settings
organizationSettings.subtitle: Manage settings and permissions for your organization.
organizationSettings.tooltip: Configure and manage settings for your organization, including team permissions, invitation controls, and project creation policies.
organizationSettings.selectOrganizationDescription: Select an organization to manage its settings

header.title: Organization Settings Hub
header.description: This page allows administrators and owners to manage settings specific to the selected organization.

selector.title: Select Your Organization
selector.description: If you belong to multiple organizations, use this selector to switch between them and manage their specific settings.

refresh.title: Refresh Data
refresh.description: Click here to reload the latest settings and team information for the selected organization.

teamSettings.title: Team & Permission Settings
teamSettings.description: This section contains controls for managing how users interact within the organization, including invitations and content creation permissions.

disableInvitations.title: Control Invitations
disableInvitations.description: (Owner Only) Enable or disable the ability for anyone to invite new members to this organization.

allowMemberInvites.title: Delegate Invitations
allowMemberInvites.description: (Owner Only) If invitations are enabled, choose whether regular members and admins (not just owners) can invite others.

membersCreateProjects.title: Project Creation Permission
membersCreateProjects.description: (Admin/Owner) Decide if regular members should be allowed to create new projects within this organization.

membersCreateDepartments.title: Department Creation (Members)
membersCreateDepartments.description: (Owner Only) Control whether regular members can create new departments.

adminsCreateDepartments.title: Department Creation (Admins)
adminsCreateDepartments.description: (Owner Only) Control whether administrators can create new departments.

overview.title: Manage Your Organization
overview.description: Use these settings to configure how your team collaborates and manages research within Quester.

teamManagement.title: Team Management Redesign
teamManagement.description: Complete overhaul of team navigation with a new sidebar interface replacing the old dropdown system.

globalSearch.title: Global Search & AI Chat
globalSearch.description: Powerful search across all your projects with integrated AI assistance for research questions.

keyInsights.title: Key Insights AI
keyInsights.description: AI-driven analysis that automatically identifies patterns and insights from your research data.

referenceExport.title: Reference Export Suite
referenceExport.description: Export your references in multiple academic formats for seamless integration with your workflow.

modelBuilding.title: Model Building Enhancements
modelBuilding.description: Advanced visual modeling tools with enhanced node types, edge customization, and workflow improvements.

tutorials.title: Interactive Tutorials
tutorials.description: Comprehensive guided tours that demonstrate features with automatic examples and hands-on learning.

toastsExtra.pleaseSelectUserAndRole: Please select a user and role

ariaLabels.toggleYearsTimePeriods: Toggle between individual years and time periods

modelBuildingTools.title: Model Building Tools
modelBuildingTools.description: Add Rectangle or Circle nodes, toggle grid visibility and snapping, and download your model as an image using this toolbar.

modelingCanvas.title: Your Modeling Canvas
modelingCanvas.description: This is your main workspace. Drag nodes from the toolbar to add them. Connect nodes by dragging between their handles.

canvasControls.title: Canvas Controls
canvasControls.description: Use these controls to zoom in/out, fit the entire model to the view, and lock/unlock the canvas panning.

minimapNavigation.title: Minimap Navigation
minimapNavigation.description: This provides an overview of your entire model. Click and drag within the minimap to quickly navigate large canvases.

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: Nodes represent the core concepts or variables in your model. Click to select, resize using handles, and double-click (if applicable) to edit content.

edges.title: Edges
edges.description: Edges show the relationships or connections between your concepts. Click an edge to select it and customize its appearance using the panel that appears.

edgeCustomization.title: Edge Customization
edgeCustomization.description: When an edge is selected, use this panel to change its style, color, arrowheads, and animation to clearly communicate the nature of the relationship.

modelViewContainer.title: Model View Container
modelViewContainer.description: This is the container for the model view. It's used to apply any additional styling or layout constraints.

subscriptionSuccess.couldNotLoadOrganization: Could not load organization details. Please refresh the page.
subscriptionSuccess.pleaseWaitProcessing: Please wait while we process your subscription for

keyInsightsExtra.dailyLimitReached: You've reached your daily insight limit
keyInsightsExtra.dailyLimitMessage: You've reached the maximum of 3 insight generations per day to optimize AI costs. Your insights will refresh tomorrow.
keyInsightsExtra.insightsAutoUpdated: Insights are automatically updated when your project data changes significantly.

publisherScoreExtra.noJournalSuggestionsYet: No Journal Suggestions Available Yet. Keep Adding Literature To Gain Suggestions.
publisherScoreExtra.journalSuggestionsExplanation: The Journal Suggestions Utilize Weighted Assessments For Journal Articles And Literature Reviews To Help Determine The Journals You Should Consider Investigating For Further Research And Publication Purposes. The Scores Are Calculated Based On Publication Recency, Author Diversity, And Keyword Relevance.
publisherScoreExtra.noConferenceSuggestionsYet: No Conference Suggestions Available Yet. Keep Adding Literature To Gain Suggestions.
publisherScoreExtra.conferenceSuggestionsExplanation: The Conference Suggestions Utilize Weighted Assessments For Conference Proceedings And Presentations To Help Determine The Conferences You Should Consider Attending Or Presenting At. The Scores Are Calculated Based On Publication Recency, Author Diversity, And Keyword Relevance.
publisherScoreExtra.noJournalAndReviewSuggestions: No Journal And Review Suggestions Available.

organizationFallbacks.notMemberOfProjects: You're not a member of any projects
organizationFallbacks.tryDifferentKeywords: Try using different keywords or clearing your search

literatureInsightsRules.missingTitleDesc: Add a title to help identify and reference this literature.
literatureInsightsRules.missingAuthorsDesc: Add the authors of this literature for proper citation.
literatureInsightsRules.missingYearDesc: Add the publication year for chronological reference.
literatureInsightsRules.missingPublisherDesc: Add the publisher information for complete citation.
literatureInsightsRules.typeNotSetDesc: Specify the type of literature for better organization.
literatureInsightsRules.statusNotSetDesc: Set the reading status to track your progress.
literatureInsightsRules.progressTooltip: Complete these tasks to improve your literature's organization and citation quality
literatureInsightsRules.wellDocumented: This literature entry is well-documented and ready for citation.

resourceUserManagerExtra.noMoreUsersAvailable: No more organization users available to add

roleManagerExtra.confirmElevatedPermissions: You are about to change a Project Owner's role using your Organization privileges. Are you sure you want to proceed?

exploreAnalytics.title: Explore Your Project Analytics
exploreAnalytics.description: This section visualizes key trends and patterns in your literature and notes, helping you understand your research landscape.

navigateViews.title: Navigate Different Views
navigateViews.description: Use these tabs to switch between different analysis categories: Overview, Notes Content, Literature Titles, and Research Design Methods.

projectOverview.title: Project Overview
projectOverview.description: See high-level trends like prevalent publishers, common keywords, publication year distribution, literature types, and a detailed breakdown of literature types by publication year.

notesContentAnalysis.title: Notes Content Analysis
notesContentAnalysis.description: Analyze the content of your notes by identifying the most frequent nouns, verbs, and adjectives used.

literatureTitleAnalysis.title: Literature Title Analysis
literatureTitleAnalysis.description: Discover common nouns, verbs, and adjectives appearing in the titles of your collected literature.

researchDesignInsights.title: Research Design Insights
researchDesignInsights.description: Understand the methodologies used in your literature, including prevalent research, sampling, measurement, and analytic designs.

viewFullscreen.title: View Fullscreen
viewFullscreen.description: Click this icon on any chart card to view a larger version in a modal window for easier inspection.

literatureTypesByYear.title: Literature Types by Year
literatureTypesByYear.description: This stacked bar chart shows the distribution of different literature types across publication years, helping you identify trends in research approaches over time.

noDataYet.title: No Data Yet?
noDataYet.description: If you see a 'No data' message, start by adding literature and notes to your project. Analytics will appear automatically as you add content.

gainDeeperInsights.title: Gain Deeper Insights
gainDeeperInsights.description: Regularly check these analytics to spot trends, identify gaps, and understand the focus of your research materials.
